user.title: Connect to UniFi Protect v6+
user.description: Enter your UniFi Protect connection details. You need to generate an API token in the Protect UI (Settings > Users > API).

data_description.host: The IP address or hostname of your UniFi Protect Console/NVR
data_description.api_token: API token generated in Protect UI (Settings > Users > API)
data_description.verify_ssl: Verify SSL certificate (disable for self-signed certificates)

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to UniFi Protect. Check: 1) Host/IP is correct, 2) UniFi Protect is running, 3) Network connectivity. If using self-signed certificate, disable SSL verification.
error.invalid_auth: Invalid API token or insufficient permissions. Check token in UniFi Protect UI (Settings > Users > API) and ensure it has full access.
error.unsupported_version: UniFi Protect version not supported or API endpoints unavailable. This integration requires UniFi Protect v6.1.79 or newer. Current error may indicate older version or service not fully started.
error.unknown: Unexpected error occurred. Check Home Assistant logs for details.

abort.already_configured: This UniFi Protect instance is already configured
